Delightful, light, airy decor. Most everything needed was available. The kitchen was well appointed with dishes, cookware, etc. Excellent set up of bar cart if you need those items. Washer and dryer available across the parking lot in an outside building. Parking for this unit is not at the door, and most availability is to the far right of the next door building.
Deck out back is coolest and best for mornings...full sun most of the afternoon. Watching golfers come and go proved to be quite amusing!
Communication pre/post stay was timely from this host.
Do note that although this bath has a hand-held shower installed, the plumbing is bypassed and is TUB ONLY. The listing SAYS tub, but Air B&B icon shows a tub with shower overhead, which is not the case. (Maybe Air B&B could correct their icon for clarity). It is a lovely, large garden tub, and as so prevents easy leaning over the edge to wash hair.
If you're a lover of a completely dark room to sleep in, I suggest bringing black poster board and painter's tape to block light from the security light in the parking lot that's just outside the bedroom window. There's a Dollar General a few miles down the road where you can purchase items if needed. The windows have nice, wooden venetian blinds, but light leaks around the edges...something certainly not in control of the host unless black out curtains are added. Poster board and tape do the trick nicely, and I use this simple fix lots of times when traveling.
Great location in the Pinehurst area, just beyond the Village proper, with limitless options in type and $-$$$$ range for dining available.

review_text: Oh, how I enjoyed my stay in Felicia's lovely treehouse! I chose this listing because it looked creative and charming, with spacious views, and I had a good deal of reading , writing, and study to do in just a few days. I needed a serene space with expansive views. Felicia's home was all of that and more. The space is SO creative, the kitchen well-equipped, the home spotless, the neighbors friendly, the decor creative. The treehouse has lovely, full-length windows all around, and they open to serene views of a golf course in the back and a sparkling lake in the front. And I could read and study on the deck until it got too dark to see, all the while watching the beautiful colors in changing sunsets. The home feels tucked-away, but Pinehurst is just a short drive away for food and fun. This was a solo trip for me, but I've already raved about it to my husband, and I'd go back in a heartbeat. Thank you for a lovely stay, Felicia.
